course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Analogue Integrated Circuits Design and Analysis
course.description: Multiple-stage operational amplifiers, frequency response, feedback analysis, stability and compensation, Slew rate, advanced amplifier design techniques, analog VLSI building blocks.

reviews.author: A random name
reviews.comment_content:
Just advanced ELEC 3400 (maybe 10 times harder with this prof), content is not extremely hard, but become harder under his teaching. Especially when he assumed that we knew everything.

The ppt slides are simple, textbook will be more helpful.

L1: CMOS Integrated circuits
L2: Analog IC chip process
L3: CMOS device models and basic amplifiers
L4: Frequency response
L5: Feedback
L6: Stability and compensation
L7: Two-stage OPAMP design
L8: Voltage reference
L9: Oscillators
reviews.comment_teaching: Razavi is the best teacher ever. You will learn from the book more than from lessons. Going to lecture is meaningless, maybe you want to find a place to take some rest, you can attend the lecture, ensure you can fall asleep in 15 mins
reviews.comment_grading: Idk how the grading works, cuz the ta only give you the mark, but never talk about which part you did wrong, you have to figure it out by yourself. But he gives high marks, I suppose. And the final project is quite straightforward, easy to get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 assignment, midterm exam, individual final project

The final project is easy if you finish all assignments
No need to revise for midterm exam, if you know the knowledge , then you will know how to do during the exam

reviews.author: Klcvv
reviews.comment_content:
1: Frequency Response
2: Feedback Analysis
3: Stability and Compensation
4: Advanced Amplifier Design

More advanced content from ELEC3400. And some new contents
reviews.comment_grading: If you just do what you did in ELEC3400, I think you will get the same grade in ELEC4420.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 homework
1 midterm exam
1 final project

Just similar to ELEC3400.

About the final project, I think you can apply the same circuit which you used in ELEC3400 final project, it almost does the same requirement in 3400, but also has some new requirements.

Overall, just as same as ELEC3400.
